content.question: ​The sales of a new product, in items per month, is modeled by the expression <math alttext="225 plus 500 log subscript 10 open parentheses 15 t plus 10 close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mn>225</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>500</mn><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>10</mn></msub><mfenced><mrow><mn>15</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, where <math alttext="t"><semantics><mi>t</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> represents the time since the product became available for purchase, in months. What is the number of items sold per month for time <math alttext="t equals 6"><semantics><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Express functions, equations, or expressions in analytically equivalent forms that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context.
